Key_Characters_Deaths.name: King Viserys I Targaryen
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: His death triggered the civil war between Rhaenyra and Aegon II.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Ser Harwin Strong
Key_Characters_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed in a fire at Harrenhal
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: Rumored lover of Rhaenyra and father of her sons, his death affected Rhaenyra deeply.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Prince Lucerys Velaryon
Key_Characters_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed by Aemond Targaryen during a dragon battle
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: His death escalated the conflict, marking an open declaration of war.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Prince Jacaerys Velaryon
Key_Characters_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed during the Battle of the Gullet
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: A significant loss for Rhaenyra's faction as he played a crucial role in gathering support.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Lord Corlys Velaryon
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: A key supporter of Rhaenyra, his death weakened her faction.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Daemon Targaryen
Key_Characters_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed in a duel with Aemond Targaryen at the Battle Above the Gods Eye
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: His death, along with Aemond's, marked a climactic moment in the war.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Queen Rhaenyra Targaryen
Key_Characters_Deaths.cause_of_death: Executed by Aegon II’s dragon, Sunfyre
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: Her death marked the downfall of the blacks and ended her claim to the throne.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: King Aegon II Targaryen
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: His death ended the war, leading to the ascension of Aegon III.

Key_Characters_Deaths.name: Ser Criston Cole
Key_Characters_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed in battle (ambush during the Battle of the Kingsroad)
Key_Characters_Deaths.significance: His death marked the loss of one of the greens' most capable commanders.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Arrax
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed by Vhagar and Aemond Targaryen during the Storm's End incident
Dragons_Deaths.significance: First major dragon casualty of the war, escalating the conflict.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Vermithor
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed during the Second Battle of Tumbleton
Dragons_Deaths.significance: One of the oldest and largest dragons, his death was a significant blow to Rhaenyra’s forces.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Sunfyre
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Mortally wounded in battle, died later from injuries
Dragons_Deaths.significance: His death symbolized the end of Aegon II's reign.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Vhagar
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed by Caraxes and Daemon Targaryen in the Battle Above the Gods Eye
Dragons_Deaths.significance: One of the largest and most feared dragons, her death was a climactic moment.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Caraxes
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed during the Battle Above the Gods Eye in a duel with Vhagar
Dragons_Deaths.significance: His death, along with Vhagar’s, marked the end of two of the most powerful dragons.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Meleys
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed by Sunfyre and Vhagar during the Battle of Rook's Rest
Dragons_Deaths.significance: Her death was a significant loss for the blacks, as Rhaenys was a capable leader.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Seasmoke
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed during the Second Battle of Tumbleton
Dragons_Deaths.significance: Seasmoke's death highlighted the internal divisions in Rhaenyra's faction.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Moondancer
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed in a battle against Sunfyre
Dragons_Deaths.significance: A fierce battle, but Moondancer was ultimately slain, marking the end of one of the younger dragons.

Dragons_Deaths.name: Tessarion
Dragons_Deaths.cause_of_death: Killed by forces loyal to Rhaenyra
Dragons_Deaths.significance: Her death marked the dwindling of the Targaryen dragons towards the war's end.
